definition[0]: a report or examination of events that hides the true facts about something so that the person who is responsible will not be punished
example[0]: The official report into the cause of the fire was labeled a whitewash.
definition[1]: a white liquid mixture used especially for painting walls
definition[2]: an occasion in sport when one player or team defeats an opponent easily, without the opponent getting any points, goals  etc
example[1]: The walls were whitewashed and covered with bullfighting posters.
definition[4]: to hide the true facts about a serious accident or illegal action
example[2]: Investigators are accused of whitewashing the governorâ€™s record.
definition[5]: to defeat an opponent in sport easily, without the opponent getting any points, goals  etc
